Tell Me More

Focus

My Major and Academic Focus

Autonomous Driving

1. 3D driving simulator building
2. Perception and Control such as ACC (Adaptive Cruise Control) and Lane Keeping with Computer Vision.

Eco-driving Control

With the V2V & V2I, Eco-driving of CAVs (Connected and Automated Vehicles) can be achieved with MPC or DRL (Deep Reinforcement Learning)

Vehicle system modeling

Vehicle system modeling for Conventional Vehicle / BEV / HEV. Run large scale simulation with HPC for performance & energy analysis.

About

Something to Show

Multi-Agent DRL

MADDPG (Multi Agent Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient) is being used.

Lane Detection

Window Sliding & Feature Extraction.

3D Visual Simulator

Based on Carla. Implemented ACC and LKC. Also Connected to 6-DOF driving simulator.

Self Driving RC vehilce

Lane keeping by lane detection using RGB camera; Also detects road signs to do longitudinal control.

Autonomous Driving of Nissan Leaf

Autonomous driving in a close area using RTK GPS & IMU.

End-to-End Self Driving

Train a self-driving vehicle in Unity environment by only providing the data from the front cameras.

Experience

Timeline

    Argonne National Laboratory

    Staff of Vehicle & Mobility Simulation Group
    Energy System Division
    Research about intelligent eco-mobility, 3D visual simulator building for CAVs, large-scale simulation and computer vision
